Search: id:a005536
Showing 1-1 of 1

%I A005536 M2274
%S A005536 1,0,0,1,3,3,4,3,3,1,0,0,1,0,0,1,3,3,4,6,9,10,12,12,13,12,12,13,15,15,
%T A005536 16,15,15,13,12,12,13,12,12,10,9,6,4,3,3,1,0,0,1,0,0,1,3,3,4,3,3,1,0,
%U A005536 0,1,0,0,1,3,3,4,6,9,10,12,12,13,12,12,13,15,15,16,18,21,22,24,27,31,33
%N A005536 a(0) = 0, a(2n) = n-a(n)-a(n-1), a(2n+1) = n-2a(n)+1.
%C A005536 A "Von Koch" sequence generated by the first Feigenbaum symbolic sequence.
%D A005536 J.-P. Allouche and J. Shallit, The ring of k-regular sequences, II, Theoret. Computer Sci., 307 (2003), 3-29.
%D A005536 N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
%D A005536 R. G. Stanton, W. L. Kocay and P. H. Dirksen, Computation of a combinatorial function, pp. 569-578 of C. J. Nash-Williams and J. Sheehan, editors, Proceedings of the Fifth British Combinatorial Conference 1975. Utilitas Math., Winnipeg, 1976.
%H A005536 T. D. Noe, <a href="/A005536/b005536.txt">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000</a>
%H A005536 J.-P. Allouche and J. Shallit, <a href="http://www.math.jussieu.fr/~allouche/kreg2.ps">The Ring of k-regular Sequences, II</a>
%H A005536 R. Stephan, <a href="/somedcgf.html">Some divide-and-conquer sequences ...</a>
%H A005536 R. Stephan, <a href="/A079944/a079944.ps">Table of generating functions</a>
%H A005536 <a href="/index/Bi#binary">Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n</a>
%F A005536 Partial sums of A065359. a(n)=sum(i=0, n, sum(k=0, i, (-1)^k*(floor(i/2^k)-2*floor(i/2/2^k)))) - _Benoit Cloitre_, Mar 28 2004
%F A005536 G.f. 1/(1-x)^2 * Sum(k>=0, (-1)^k*x^2^k/(1+x^2^k)). - _Ralf Stephan_, Apr 27 2003
%F A005536 a(n) = -n*(n-2) + 3*sum(k=1, n-1, sum(i=1, k, A035263(i+1))), where A035263 is the first Feigenbaum symbolic sequence. - Benoit Cloitre, May 29 2003
%t A005536 a[n_] := a[n] = If[n == 0, 0, hn = Floor[n/2]; If[OddQ[n], hn - 2 a[hn] + 1, hn - a[hn] - a[hn - 1]]]; t = Table[a[n], {n, 100}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Mar 22 2012 *)
%o A005536 (PARI) a(n)=-n*(n-2)+3*sum(k=1,n-1,sum(i=1,k,abs(subst(Pol(binary(i+1))- Pol(binary(i)),x,1)%2))) (from B. Cloitre)
%o A005536 (PARI) a(n)=polcoeff(1/(1-x)^2*sum(k=0,10, (-1)^k*x^2^k/(1+x^2^k)) +O(x^(n+1)),n)
%Y A005536 Cf. A071992, A073059.
%K A005536 nonn
%O A005536 1,5
%A A005536 _N. J. A. Sloane_.
%E A005536 More terms and better description from _Ralf Stephan_, Sep 13 2003
